arts.ttl: Kane hits landmark goal in victory over Werder Bremen
arts.sum: Harry Kane scores twice in Bayern Munich's win over Werder Bremen to become the fastest player this century to reach 100 goals for a club playing in one of Europe's top five leagues.

arts.ttl: European football: Kane fastest to 100 goals as Bayern thump Werder Bremen
arts.sum: Kane hits landmark to beat Ronaldo and Haaland Marseille go top after late 2-1 victory at Strasbourg Harry Kane scored his 100th goal for Bayern Munich on Friday night, reaching the landmark in just 104 matches to become the fastest player this century to reach 100 goals for a single club. The England captain was on target twice in a 4-0 home win against Werder Bremen, taking him to three figures and extending Bayern’s 100% record after five Bundesliga outings. In doing so Kane has nudged ahead of Erling Haaland and Cristiano Ronaldo, who took 105 matches to reach three figures for Manchester City and Real Madrid respectively. The pair had jointly shared the scoring record in Europe’s top five leagues but Kane has now gone clear on his own. Continue reading...

arts.sum: After a rare midweek off, Bayern Munich kick-started Bundesliga matchday five with a home game against Werder Bremen The game went just as you would expect it to. Bayern would…

arts.ttl: Record-breaker Harry Kane reaches 100-goal milestone as Bayern Munich crush Werder Bremen
arts.sum: Harry Kane scored twice to reach 100 goals for Bayern Munich in record time as the Bundesliga leaders cruised to a comfortable 4-0 win over Werder Bremen at the Allianz Arena. After the visitors struggled to clear a corner, the ball was worked back to Olise on the right, who floated a cross into the box where Jonathan Tah cleverly backheeled the ball into the net for his first Bayern goal.

arts.ttl: Arsenal goalkeeper set for HARDEST debut ever: Karl Hein faces Bayern Munich baptism of fire
arts.sum: When Karl Hein left Arsenal in the summer to join Werder Bremen on loan, he would not have envisaged facing such a daunting debut. “Arsenal goalkeeper Karl Hein also came on loan and is set to make his debut in the most difficult place possible: Bayern Munich’s Allianz Arena.
